it.unibo.alchemist.core.interfaces

Interface ISimulation<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type which describes the concentration of a molecule
    All Superinterfaces:
    Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Simulation

    public interface ISimulation<T>
extends Runnable

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Runnable

        run

    • Method Detail

      • addOutputMonitor

        void addOutputMonitor(OutputMonitor<T> op)
        Adds an OutputMonitor to this simulation.
        Parameters:
        op - the OutputMonitor to add

      • getEnvironment

        IEnvironment<T> getEnvironment()
        Allows to access the current environment.
        Returns:
        a reference to the current Environment. The environment is not a copy but back-ends the real environment used in the simulation. Manipulate it carefully

      • getFinalStep

        long getFinalStep()
        Returns:
        the step at which this simulation will eventually stop.

      • getFinalTime

        ITime getFinalTime()
        Allows to at which time this simulation will end.
        Returns:
        the final time

      • getStatus

        Status getStatus()
        Allows to access the current status.
        Returns:
        the current Status of the simulation

      • getStep

        long getStep()
        Allows to access the current simulation step.
        Returns:
        the current step

      • getTime

        ITime getTime()
        Allows to know which is the current simulation time.
        Returns:
        the current time

      • pause

        void pause()
        When called, the simulation finishes its execution cycle and then stops. It will be possible to edit the environment manually and to restart the execution by calling play().

      • pauseAndWait

        void pauseAndWait()
        When called, the simulation finishes its execution cycle and then stops. It will be possible to edit the environment manually and to restart the execution by calling play(). The caller will be suspended until the simulation effectively restarted.

      • play

        void play()
        Tries to resume the simulation from stopped and paused Status. It's not guaranteed to work if status is stopped. Calling it when status is running should produce no effect at all.

      • playAndWait

        void playAndWait()
        Tries to resume the simulation from stopped and paused Status. It's not guaranteed to work if status is stopped. Calling it when status is running should produce no effect at all. The caller will be suspended until the simulation effectively paused.

      • playSingleStep

        void playSingleStep()
        Runs a single simulation step, then pauses the simulation. If the simulation is already running, it will be paused, but the number of steps run is not guaranteed to be one.

      • playSingleStepAndWait

        void playSingleStepAndWait()
        Runs a single simulation step, then pauses the simulation and waits until it is effectively paused to return back the control. If the simulation is already running, it will be paused, but the number of steps run is not guaranteed to be one.

      • removeOutputMonitor

        void removeOutputMonitor(OutputMonitor<T> op)
        Removes an OutputMonitor to this simulation. If the OutputMonitor was not among those already added, this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        op - the OutputMonitor to add

      • stop

        void stop()
        When called, the simulation stops. It's not guaranteed that it could be resumed.

      • stopAndWait

        void stopAndWait()
        When called, the simulation stops. It's not guaranteed that it could be resumed. The caller will be suspended until the simulation effectively stopped.

      • waitForCompletion

        void waitForCompletion()
        Suspends the caller until the simulation reaches the STOPPED Status.
